skill.name: recon-nmap
skill.description: Network reconnaissance and security auditing using Nmap for port scanning, service enumeration, and vulnerability detection. Use when: (1) Conducting authorized network reconnaissance and asset discovery, (2) Enumerating network services and identifying running versions, (3) Detecting security vulnerabilities through NSE scripts, (4) Mapping network topology and firewall rules, (5) Performing compliance scanning for security assessments, (6) Validating network segmentation and access controls.

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing no executable code. The skill provides Nmap command examples, workflow checklists, and template configurations for authorized network reconnaissance. No network calls, file system access, or command execution occurs within the skill itself.

content.value_statement: Network reconnaissance is essential for security assessments but requires structured workflows to ensure thoroughness and compliance. This skill provides ready-to-use Nmap commands, workflow checklists, and integration templates for port scanning, service enumeration, and vulnerability detection.
actual_capabilities: Execute Nmap host discovery and ping sweeps on target networks
Perform port scanning with multiple techniques (TCP SYN, UDP, connect scans)
Run service version detection and OS fingerprinting on discovered hosts
Execute Nmap Scripting Engine (NSE) scripts for vulnerability detection
Generate scan reports in multiple formats (XML, grepable, normal output)
Apply firewall evasion techniques and timing optimizations
limitations: Nmap must be installed on the system before using this skill
Network scanning requires explicit authorization from network owner
Skill provides guidance only; actual scanning is performed by Nmap
Results depend on network conditions and target configuration

prompt_templates.title: Quick host discovery
prompt_templates.scenario: Find live hosts on a network
prompt_templates.prompt: Use Nmap to discover live hosts on network 192.168.1.0/24 using ping sweep and output results to live_hosts.txt

prompt_templates.title: Port enumeration
prompt_templates.prompt: Run Nmap service version detection (-sV) on all hosts in live_hosts.txt and save results to service_scan

prompt_templates.title: Vulnerability scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Execute NSE vulnerability scripts against targets to check for MS17-010, Heartbleed, and SSL vulnerabilities

prompt_templates.title: Comprehensive assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: Run comprehensive Nmap reconnaissance including host discovery, full port scan, OS detection, and vulnerability scripts on 10.0.1.0/24

output_examples.input: Scan 192.168.1.0/24 for live hosts and open ports

best_practices: Always verify written authorization before scanning any network or system
Start with host discovery before port scanning to reduce scan time and network impact
Use rate limiting (--max-rate) and timing templates (-T1 to -T4) to avoid overwhelming targets
anti_patterns: Running aggressive scans (-T5) without rate limiting on production networks
Scanning without first identifying the scope and obtaining proper authorization
Failing to document scan parameters and results for compliance and incident response

faq.question: Is Nmap installed by default?
faq.answer: No. Nmap must be installed separately on the system before using this skill. Install via package manager (apt, yum, brew).

faq.question: Can this skill scan any network?
faq.answer: Only scan networks you own or have explicit written authorization for. Unauthorized scanning may be illegal.

faq.question: Does this skill work offline?
faq.answer: Yes. All Nmap commands execute locally. External URLs in documentation are references only.

faq.question: Can I integrate with CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill provides GitHub Actions templates for automated security scanning in pipelines.

faq.question: What scan types are supported?
faq.answer: TCP SYN (-sS), TCP Connect (-sT), UDP (-sU), service detection (-sV), OS detection (-O), and NSE scripts.

faq.question: How does this differ from vulnerability scanners?
faq.answer: Nmap provides network discovery and basic vulnerability detection via scripts. Full vulnerability scanners (Nessus, OpenVAS) offer deeper assessment.
